facts: Jerusalem is one of the most important cities in the Bible and was the site of the Jewish Temple and many events in Jesus’s life.
Bethlehem is a small town south of Jerusalem that the Bible names as the birthplace of King David and later of Jesus.
The Sea of Galilee is actually a freshwater lake where Jesus taught crowds, calmed a storm, and called some of his first disciples who were fishermen.
The Jordan River is famous in the Bible as a place of crossing into the Promised Land and as the river where John baptized Jesus.
Nazareth is the town in Galilee where Jesus grew up, showing that important Bible stories often happen in ordinary places.
Jericho is called one of the oldest cities in the world and is known in the Bible for its walls falling after the Israelites marched around it.
Damascus is an ancient city where Saul’s life changed dramatically on the road nearby, and he became Paul, a major leader in early Christianity.
sources_hint: Look up these places in a Bible atlas or in book introductions and maps in study Bibles for extra background.
